definition: a looped strap sewed at the side or the rear top of a boot to help in pulling it on
designed to function independently of outside direction : capable of using one internal function or process to control another
examples: a bootstrap operation to load a computer

definition: carried out with minimum resources or advantages
to promote or develop by initiative and effort with little or no assistance
examples: … turns out to be pretty talented at identifying and bootstrapping promising creative endeavors.
